oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An exhortation, to the Bushmen, to be careful of food in time of plenty, is followed by a description of the jackalâ€™s doings with regard to food, etc. (L VIII.

7456). When food is plentiful (in times of abundant rainfall) the people say that they must put the food away properly so they will not be like the jackal, which is always going along looking for where it has put its food (its 'plenty').
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Habits of jackals
